poem:
### In the Midst of Pop

Arid land whispers,  
Mudgee's quiet soul  
disturbed by cans and colours.  
In Warhol's tin,  
the mundane becomes profound,  
while dots of Lichtenstein  
mock the scream within.  
Art's journey, far from Welsh chapel,  
yet here I stand—  
a pilgrim puzzled,  
seeking old truths  
in new garb.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Pop art, folk festivals and grape crushing: Australian summer events worth travelling for New South Wales Icons of Pop Art: Warhol and Lichtenstein, MudgeeTwo of the 20th century’s most influential artists, Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein have works on display at Mudgee Arts Precinct. Visitors can take a look at Warhol’s iconic Campbell’s soup cans up close, or get comically existential with Lichtenstein’s Reflections on the Scream.On now until 15 March 2026. The Hidden Line:". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
